'''{{PAGENAME}}''' is an American author, best known for the novel {{Wikipedia|World War Z}}. He is the son of comedian {{Wikipedia|Mel Brooks}} and actress {{Wikipedia|Anne Bancroft}}. Within the ''Minecraft'' franchise, he is known for being the author of a trilogy focusing on the characters [[Guy]] and [[Summer]], beginning with [[Minecraft: The Island|''Minecraft: The Island'']].

== In the ''Minecraft'' franchise ==
{{Expand section|Document and quote his appearances at Minecon}}
In 2016, Brooks was announced to helm ''[[Minecraft: The Island]]'', the first official novel published by [[Mojang Studios]].<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.pcmag.com/news/zombie-author-max-brooks-writing-minecraft-novel|title=Zombie Author Max Brooks Writing Minecraft Novel|author=Stephanie Mlot|website=PC Mag|date=September 26, 2016}}</ref> In order to prepare for the book, he made a world within {{JE}} to tinker with and plan any potential scenarios.<ref>{{Mcnet|interview-max-brooks|Interview: Max Brooks|June 29, 2017|Marsh Davies}}</ref> The following months revealed the cover, while the book would release on July 18, 2017. <ref>{{Mcnet|minecraft-novel-cover-revealed|Minecraft Novel Cover Revealed!|September 24, 2016|Marsh Davies}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|url=https://ew.com/books/2017/02/23/max-brooks-minecraft-novel-interview/|title=''World War Z'' author Max Brooks explains his ''Minecraft'' novel, ''Minecraft: The Island''|author=Isabella Biedenharn|website=Entertainment Weekly|date=February 23, 2017}}</ref>

In 2021, the book received a sequel in the form of ''[[Minecraft: The Mountain]]''. In order to promote it, a [[Minecraft: The Mountain (map)|map]] was released continuing its story on the [[Marketplace]], Brooks being interviewed on its continuity.<ref>{{Mcnet|the-mountain|The Mountain|March 2, 2021|Alex Wiltshire}}</ref>

In 2023, the series would conclude with its third installment, [[Minecraft: The Village|''Minecraft: The Village'']]. Feeling the story concluded satisfyingly, Brooks would recount on his experiences writing the trilogy in an interview with Brightly.<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.readbrightly.com/max-brooks-says-goodbye-to-minecraft-with-the-village/|title=Max Brooks Says Goodbye to Minecraft With ''The Village''|author=Laura Lambert|website=Brightly}}</ref>
